meanings.def: the white liquid produced by cows, goats and some other animals as food for their young and used as a drink by humans
examples: a pint/litre of milk
a bottle/carton of milk
She drank a glass of cool frothy milk.
fresh/dried/powdered milk
Do you take milk in your tea?
milk products (= butter, cheese, etc.)
milk production/prices
I am allergic to cow's milk.
(British English) full-fat/semi-skimmed/skimmed milk (= milk with none/some/most of the fat removed)
(North American English) Shall I get skim milk or 2%?
Don't drink the milk—it's off.
Dried milk keeps better than fluid milk.
The milk has gone off/​turned sour.
They've stopped delivering milk in our area.
a calcium-fortified milk which provides more calcium than regular milk
Dairy cows produce more milk when listening to music.
Why is there no milk in the fridge?

meanings.def: the white liquid that is produced by women and female mammals for feeding their babies
examples: breast milk
Mammals rely on mother's milk for nutrition and immune protection.
She expressed some milk so her husband could do the night feeding.

meanings.def: a white liquid produced by or made from plants
examples: The recipe uses fresh coconut milk and lime juice.
Can I have oat milk in my coffee, please?
Vegans can substitute soy milk and dairy-free butter.
Serve with a glass of sweet, creamy almond milk.

meanings.def: to waste time worrying about something that has happened that you cannot do anything about
examples: As the saying goes—it's no use crying over spilt milk.

meanings.def: a place where life is pleasant and easy and people are very happy
examples: He dreamed of emigrating to Canada—the land of milk and honey.

meanings.def: kind behaviour, considered to be natural to humans

idioms.def: to waste time worrying about something that has happened that you cannot do anything about
examples: As the saying goes—it's no use crying over spilt milk.

idioms.idiom: the land of milk and honey
idioms.def: a place where life is pleasant and easy and people are very happy
examples: He dreamed of emigrating to Canada—the land of milk and honey.

idioms.def: kind behaviour, considered to be natural to humans

meanings.def: to take milk from a cow, goat, etc.
to obtain as much money, advantage, etc. for yourself as you can from a particular situation, especially in a dishonest way
examples: milk A (from B) She's milked a small fortune from the company over the years.
milk B (of A) She's milked the company of a small fortune.
I know he's had a hard time lately, but he's certainly milking it for all it's worth (= using it as an excuse to do things that people would normally object to).
He had milked her for information.
These large firms milk the government of subsidies.

meanings.def: to get from somebody/something all the money, help, information, etc. they have, usually giving nothing in return
examples: By earning millions from racing and giving pennies back, the bookmakers are milking the sport dry.

idioms.def: to get from somebody/something all the money, help, information, etc. they have, usually giving nothing in return
examples: By earning millions from racing and giving pennies back, the bookmakers are milking the sport dry.
